item.title: Leah add a quote by E.B. White
item.description: "If the world were merely seductive, that would be easy. If it were merely challenging, that would be no problem. But I arise in the morning torn between a desire to improve the world and a desire to enjoy the world. This makes it hard to plan the day." -- E.B. White

item.title: Leah add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description:
"Never put off till tomorrow what may be done day after tomorrow just as well".
From: "More Maxims of Mark" -- Mark Twain

item.title: Leah add a quote by Mae West
item.description: "You only live once, but if you do it right, once is enough." -- Mae West

item.title: Leah add a quote by Maya Angelou
item.description: "There is no greater agony than bearing an untold story inside you." -- Maya Angelou

item.title: Leah add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "I am enough of an artist to draw freely upon my imagination. Imagination is more important than knowledge. Knowledge is limited. Imagination encircles the world." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Leah add a quote by H. Jackson Brown Jr.
item.description: "Twenty years from now you will be more disappointed by the things that you didn't do than by the ones you did do. So throw off the bowlines. Sail away from the safe harbor. Catch the trade winds in your sails. Explore. Dream. Discover." -- H. Jackson Brown Jr.

item.title: Leah add a quote by Pablo Picasso
item.description: "Every child is an artist. The problem is how to remain an artist once he grows up." -- Pablo Picasso

item.title: Leah add a quote by Roald Dahl
item.description: "And above all, watch with glittering eyes the whole world around you because the greatest secrets are always hidden in the most unlikely places. Those who don't believe in magic will never find it." -- Roald Dahl

item.title: Leah add a quote by Roald Dahl
item.description: "So, please, oh please, we beg, we pray, go throw your TV set away, and in its place you can install, a lovely bookcase on the wall." -- Roald Dahl

item.title: Leah add a quote by Roald Dahl
item.description: "Two hours of writing fiction leaves this writer completely drained. For those two hours he has been in a different place with totally different people." -- Roald Dahl

item.title: Leah add a quote by Shel Silverstein
item.description: "Listen to the mustn'ts, child. Listen to the don'ts. Listen to the shouldn'ts, the impossibles, the won'ts. Listen to the never haves, then listen close to me... Anything can happen, child. Anything can be." -- Shel Silverstein

item.title: Leah add a quote by Shel Silverstein
item.description: "Once i spoke the language of the flowers,Once i undrestand each word the caterpillar said,Once i smiled in secret at the gossip of the starlings," -- Shel Silverstein

item.title: Leah add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "Friendship is born at that moment when one man says to another: "What! You too? I thought that no one but myself . . .&#34;" -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: Leah add a quote by William Nicholson
item.description: "We read to know we're not alone." -- William Nicholson

item.title: Leah add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "I believe in Christianity as I believe that the sun has risen: not only because I see it, but because by it I see everything else." -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: Leah add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "A children's story that can only be enjoyed by children is not a good children's story in the slightest." -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: Leah add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "If we find ourselves with a desire that nothing in this world can satisfy, the most probable explanation is that we were made for another world." -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: Leah add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "Atheism turns out to be too simple. If the whole universe has no meaning, we should never have found out that it has no meaning..." -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: Leah add a quote by C. S. Lewis
item.description: "I didn’t go to religion to make me happy. I always knew a bottle of Port would do that. If you want a religion to make you feel really comfortable, I certainly don’t recommend Christianity." -- C. S. Lewis

item.title: Leah add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "It is a good rule after reading a new book, never to allow yourself another new one till you have read an old one in between." -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: Leah add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "Some day you will be old enough to start reading fairy tales again." -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: Leah add a quote by J.M. Barrie
item.description: "When the first baby laughed for the first time, its laugh broke into a thousand pieces, and they all went skipping about, and that was the beginning of fairies." -- J.M. Barrie

item.title: Leah add a quote by J.M. Barrie
item.description: "The reason birds can fly and we can't is simply because they have perfect faith, for to have faith is to have wings." -- J.M. Barrie

item.title: Leah add a quote by J.M. Barrie
item.description: "Stars are beautiful, but they must not take an active part in anything, they must just look on forever. It is a punishment put on them for something they did so long ago that no star now knows what it was." -- J.M. Barrie

item.title: Leah add a quote by Frances Hodgson Burnett
item.description: "Oh,Sara. It is like a story." "It is a story...everything is a story. You are a story-I am a story. Miss Minchin is a story." -- Frances Hodgson Burnett

item.title: Leah add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "We are all in the gutter, but some of us are looking at the stars." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Leah add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "To live is the rarest thing in the world. Most people exist, that is all." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Leah add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "If one cannot enjoy reading a book over and over again, there is no use in reading it at all." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Leah add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "I am not young enough to know everything." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Leah add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "Yes: I am a dreamer. For a dreamer is one who can only find his way by moonlight, and his punishment is that he sees the dawn before the rest of the world." -- Oscar Wilde
